title: Understand Scatter Plots
text: A scatter plot shows the relationship between two variables by displaying data points on a graph. Your job is to determine if these data points form a straight line. That's when we say they are linearly related.

title: Check for Patterns
text: Look at the data points. Do they appear to form a straight line when you draw an imaginary line through them, or do they create a curve or cluster arbitrarily? This visual check can help you decide if there is a linear relationship.

title: Account for Trends
text: Try to see whether there's a consistent increase or decrease in the values as you move from one point to the next. A sharp increase or decrease might indicate a non-linear relationship.

title: Plot in Your Mind
text: Imagine plotting the points $$(1,46)...(6,136)$$ is each point adding up smoothly to form a straight line, or are there jumps and curves? This will help you visualize the pattern.

title: Draw an Imaginary Line
text: Try drawing an imaginary straight line through these points. If points are closely hugging this line, the relationship is likely linear. If they don't, then it might be more complex.
